mdRecord.dcterms:title: Research card box
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Charles Bruce Morton [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:medium: wood (plant material); paper (fiber product); cloth; metal [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Data from Mayo Clinic experiments conducted by Dr. Charles Bruce Morton from 1924-1927. Box contains handwritten cards, photographic prints, negatives, and a cloth with various types of surgical needles. Card divider labels include: X-ray, GI tract, peritonitis, ulcers, jejunal patches, duodenal drainage, etc.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Owned by Dr. Charles Bruce Morton [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medicine--Research
